title: 271-Kilometer 2010 Porsche 911 Sport Classic
description: This 2010 Porsche 911 Sport Classic is #132 of 250 examples produced for the European market and was purchased new by the current owner at Porsche Zentrum Berlin-Potsdam in Germany. The car has 271 kilometers (~168 miles) and is powered by a 408-horsepower 3.8L flat-six linked to a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The coupe is finished in Sport Classic Gray over Espresso Natural leather with woven inserts and features the Exclusive Powerkit, a "double-dome" roof, a ducktail spoiler, 19" Fuchs-style wheels, PASM dampers, heated front Sport seats, and Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes. This 997.2 Sport Classic is now offered in Berlin, Germany, on dealer consignment with the owner's manual and German registration.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 271-Kilometer 2010 Porsche 911 Sport Classic at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #193,231.
text: This 2010 Porsche 911 Sport Classic is #132 of 250 examples produced for the European market and was purchased new by the current owner at Porsche Zentrum Berlin-Potsdam in Germany. The car has 271 kilometers (~168 miles) and is powered by a 408-horsepower 3.8L flat-six linked to a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The coupe is finished in Sport Classic Gray over Espresso Natural leather with woven inserts and features the Exclusive Powerkit, a “double-dome” roof, a ducktail spoiler, 19″ Fuchs-style wheels, PASM dampers, heated front Sport seats, and Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes. This 997.2 Sport Classic is now offered in Berlin, Germany, on dealer consignment with the owner’s manual and German registration. The 911 Sport Classic was unveiled at the 2009 Frankfurt Motor Show and paid homage to the Carrera RS 2.7 of the early 1970s. Produced exclusively for the European market, the Sport Classic was solely offered in a Sport Classic Gray finish with gray over-the-top stripes. The model is distinguished by a ducktail spoiler, a “double-dome” roof, and revised front and rear fascias. Additional features include a lip spoiler, alloy door skins, and dual exhaust outlets. Fuchs-style 19” wheels are finished in gloss black with polished lips and are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires. Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) with yellow Porsche-branded calipers were equipped from the factory, and the car is further equipped with Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM), Porsche Stability Management (PSM), an active brake differential (ABD), and Anti-Slip Regulation (ASR). The heated power-adjustable front Sport seats are trimmed in Espresso Natural leather with woven inserts, gray piping, and 911 Sport Classic logos on the headrests. Matching upholstery extends to the dashboard, center console, and door panels, and square weave carpets and mats line the floors. Aluminum trim adorns the shifter and handbrake handle, and additional appointments comprise a Sport shifter, gray seatbelts, automatic climate control, a Bose sound system, and Porsche Communication Management (PCM) with navigation. A plaque on the passenger side of the dashboard indicates that the car is #132 of 250 in the series. A leather-wrapped steering wheel frames instrumentation comprised of a central 8k-rpm tachometer with vertical stripes and “911 Sport Classic” script accents that is flanked by a 330-km/h speedometer and auxiliary gauges. A stopwatch was added to the dashboard as part of the Sport Chrono Package. The digital odometer indicates 271 kilometers (~168 miles). The naturally aspirated 3.8-liter flat-six features the “Exclusive Powerkit”, including a carbon-fiber air cleaner box, ported-and-polished cylinder heads, and a revised ECU. Factory output was rated at 408 horsepower and 310 lb-ft of torque, an increase of approximately 23 horsepower over the standard Carrera S. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The belly pan is constructed of carbon-fiber with molded-in NACA ducts. Decoding the option sticker in the owner’s manual reveals the following information: L63A – Sport Classic Gray paint C00 – Version for Germany XCZ – Sport shifter 507 – Internal production code 619 – Bluetooth connectivity 09971 – Exclusive options The vehicle is being sold on its German registration, which serves as the ownership document in Germany. html:
This 2010 Porsche 911 Sport Classic is #132 of 250 examples produced for the European market and was purchased new by the current owner at Porsche Zentrum Berlin-Potsdam in Germany. The car has 271 kilometers (~168 miles) and is powered by a 408-horsepower 3.8L flat-six linked to a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The coupe is finished in Sport Classic Gray over Espresso Natural leather with woven inserts and features the Exclusive Powerkit, a “double-dome” roof, a ducktail spoiler, 19″ Fuchs-style wheels, PASM dampers, heated front Sport seats, and Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes. This 997.2 Sport Classic is now offered in Berlin, Germany, on dealer consignment with the owner’s manual and German registration.

The 911 Sport Classic was unveiled at the 2009 Frankfurt Motor Show and paid homage to the Carrera RS 2.7 of the early 1970s. Produced exclusively for the European market, the Sport Classic was solely offered in a Sport Classic Gray finish with gray over-the-top stripes.

The model is distinguished by a ducktail spoiler, a “double-dome” roof, and revised front and rear fascias. Additional features include a lip spoiler, alloy door skins, and dual exhaust outlets.

Fuchs-style 19” wheels are finished in gloss black with polished lips and are mounted with Pirelli P Zero tires. Porsche Ceramic Composite Brakes (PCCB) with yellow Porsche-branded calipers were equipped from the factory, and the car is further equipped with Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM), Porsche Stability Management (PSM), an active brake differential (ABD), and Anti-Slip Regulation (ASR).

The heated power-adjustable front Sport seats are trimmed in Espresso Natural leather with woven inserts, gray piping, and 911 Sport Classic logos on the headrests. Matching upholstery extends to the dashboard, center console, and door panels, and square weave carpets and mats line the floors. Aluminum trim adorns the shifter and handbrake handle, and additional appointments comprise a Sport shifter, gray seatbelts, automatic climate control, a Bose sound system, and Porsche Communication Management (PCM) with navigation.

A plaque on the passenger side of the dashboard indicates that the car is #132 of 250 in the series.

A leather-wrapped steering wheel frames instrumentation comprised of a central 8k-rpm tachometer with vertical stripes and “911 Sport Classic” script accents that is flanked by a 330-km/h speedometer and auxiliary gauges. A stopwatch was added to the dashboard as part of the Sport Chrono Package. The digital odometer indicates 271 kilometers (~168 miles).

The naturally aspirated 3.8-liter flat-six features the “Exclusive Powerkit”, including a carbon-fiber air cleaner box, ported-and-polished cylinder heads, and a revised ECU. Factory output was rated at 408 horsepower and 310 lb-ft of torque, an increase of approximately 23 horsepower over the standard Carrera S.

Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed manual transaxle and a limited-slip differential. The belly pan is constructed of carbon-fiber with molded-in NACA ducts.

Decoding the option sticker in the owner’s manual reveals the following information:

  • L63A – Sport Classic Gray paint
  • C00 – Version for Germany
  • XCZ – Sport shifter
  • 507 – Internal production code
  • 619 – Bluetooth connectivity
  • 09971 – Exclusive options

The vehicle is being sold on its German registration, which serves as the ownership document in Germany.
